alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 4:41AM CDT until June 10 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Osage and Pawnee. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - 1 to 2 inches of rain fall fallen across the area in a short period of time. An additional inch or so of rain is possible before the heavy rain ends. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Sand Springs... Pawhuska... Pawnee... Skiatook... Hominy... Cleveland... Fairfax... Barnsdall... Shidler... Wynona... Jennings... Ralston... Avant... Westport... Osage... Burbank... Hallett... Blackburn... Terlton... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
